docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, July 8 Latin-American political refugees in Argentina, who feel trapped, afraid and frustrated, are mounting almost desperate acts of pressure on the United Nations and foreign embassies to help them leave the country.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, July 8 Latin-American political refugees in Argentina, who feel trapped, afraid and frustrated, are mounting almost desperate acts of pressure on the United Nations and foreign embassies to help them leave the country.
docs.abstract: Latin-Amer pol refugees are mounting almost desperate acts of pressure on UN and foreign embassies to help them leave Argentina; Chilean and Uruguayan exiles begin hunger strike to obtain visas to new country; another group of 27 Chileans have refused to leave Canadian Embassy until they are given visas; pressure on UN High Comr for Refugees has increased since 25 Chileans were beaten allegedly by police and mil personnel; Interior Min has issued expulsion orders for 46 refugees with pol and criminal records since junta took control (M)

headline.main: Exiles in Argentina Struggle to Leave

byline.original: By JUAN de ONIS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 14 (AP) Uruguay's conservative Council of the Nation today named Aparicio Mendez, a 72-year-old lawyer, to be the country's new President.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 14 (AP) Uruguay's conservative Council of the Nation today named Aparicio Mendez, a 72-year-old lawyer, to be the country's new President.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan Council of Nation appts Aparicio Mendez as new Pres to serve 5-yr term beginning Sept 1; succeeds Acting Pres Alberto Demicheli; speculation that Uruguay will make gradual return to representative democracy (M)

headline.main: Uruguay Appoints A New President For 5-Year Term

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, July 17-- The highest Roman Catholic authorities in Argentina have expressed deep concern to the military authorities over the lack of an investigation of the killing of three priests and two seminarians in a parish residence.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, July 17-- The highest Roman Catholic authorities in Argentina have expressed deep concern to the military authorities over the lack of an investigation of the killing of three priests and two seminarians in a parish residence.
docs.abstract: Argentine RC authorities concerned over lack of investigation into killing of 3 priests and 2 seminarians at St Patrick's Parish; attribute killings to policemen seeking reprisals against alleged left-wing subversives after bomb explosion that killed 20 policemen; are concerned about security of priests and Catholic laymen who have been arrested and in some cases have disappeared or whose abandoned bodies have been found later; Rev Alfred Leaden of Irish Pallottine Congregation listed among dead priests; Revs Orlando Yorio and Francisco Yalics have been held since May 23; Yalics faces expulsion; Maria Monica Solino Plateo, daughter of prominent Uruguayan RC atty, has not been seen since she was arrested July 7, allegedly by army intelligence (M)

headline.main: SLAYINGS ANGER ARGENTINE CHURCH; Top Catholic Leaders Voice Concern at Lack of Inquiry on Killing of 3 Priests Blast Shocks Security Forces Message Written on Wall Priest Faces Expulsion
